website_summaries.verdict: One of the most accurate digital models on the market today. Readings may take a few more seconds than others, but easy to read and accurate within a half pound.
pros: Can measure pressures up to 150 PSI
Forms strong, leak-free seal on valve stem
cons: Doesn't always produce readings on first attempt
Does not hold readings after removal from stem

website_summaries.verdict: The 150 PSI upper limit is good for owners of larger vehicles, including trucks and RVs.
pros: Valve stem seals in any position
Lighted LED display good for nighttime readings

customer_reviews.title: DIY silicone gasket
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews complained about the lack of rubber at contact with the valve causing air leakage, failed readings and general annoyance. No more. With a DIY rubber gasket, this thing functions perfectly. Can't be happier. The air leakage problem was eliminated in such totality that at first I even doubted if my gauge was still working at all because of the newfound total silence was so unfamiliar and felt surreal. DIY guide: Find one of your unused in-ear earbuds' silicone/rubber heads, cut a thin piece off the inner tube. See photos. Place it inside the tube of this gauge. No need to glue it. It will stay in place after one use. Voila! Experience the heavenly seal.
customer_reviews.author: Sheng

customer_reviews.title: Great little gauge and very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Had the Accutire MS-4021B checked at our calibration lab on a NIST certified master gauge +-.02 Psi that's pretty good
customer_reviews.author: SharpSeaz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard to read.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the reviews miss my main complaint. The description says it has an "easy to read" LCD. First, it is not an LCD, it is an LED. Second, it is not easy to read; the numbers are tiny and faintly red, not easy to read at all. Worse yet are the labels that tell you which type of reading you are getting, i.e., psi vs. bar vs. ??? Would not recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on February 23, 2018. Used it a few times to check the tire pressure on my minivan and it worked ok. Went to use it yesterday and it was dead. You could push the activation button but the digital display never lit up. I replaced the three LR44 batteries but the display was still dead. So I've had this for 10 months and the batteries died and replacing them did not bring the gauge back to life. Other tire pressure gauges I've had lasted for many years. This didn't even last one year. Avoid it cause it is junk.
customer_reviews.author: DennisV

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate and no way to calibrate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this digital tire pressure along with the Viair 88P Portable Air Compressor. I have an extra vehicle that I did not drive most of the summer so I decided to inflate the tires to 35psi using the air compressor that had its own gauge. When I used the Accutire MS-4021B, it read 91psi on the first tire. The other 3 tires also read in the 90s. The LED was small but I toggled through all the readings and confirmed that it was reporting the psi in the 90s. I tried to search to see if there is a way to calibrate this but there was not. Not worth leaving in my car; no where near reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Thinh N.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've had a digital Tekton tire gauge for a few years and it's worked flawlessly. Decided to try this model for a 2nd car. Worked the day I received it. Tried to use it today (couple months later) and it just reads 0.0 on every tire. Too late to return so it'll go in the trash and I'll buy another Tekton gauge. Maybe it came with an almost dead battery? Still cheaper and easier to order the Tekton than replace the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: nozamA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unable to evaluate this product. I received the shipment promptly however it did not work. Upon checking I discovered that the batteries were corroded. I requested a refund and was given one immediately. Very good customer service. I own an earlier model of this product and have had it for about six years and it works perfectly so this was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hartung

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use & Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a digital gauge and has an easy to read display. It is accurate and worked as expected. I also purchased a manual type gauge and both read to within a .5 PSI difference of each other which makes this one very accurate in my opinion. It requires 3 LR44 batteries which come with the unit. Instructions state the batteries will last 1 year based on 5 uses per day so you should expect a longer battery life. It also has a 5 year warranty from the manufacturer from the date of purchase. Keep the instruction leaflet for this information. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: jtejas

customer_reviews.title: This seems to be a nice gauge. I just received it today and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a nice gauge. I just received it today and the first thing I do is check accuracy. I have a 15 inch test gauge that goes from 0 to 150 pounds in 0.01 pound increments. The Accutire gauge will measure in 0.5 pound increments. I use if for putting air in tires so 1⁄2 pound is good enough for me. I did check this gauge at 5, 35, and 70 pounds of pressure and it is accurate within .5 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Cor

customer_reviews.title: Batteries were dead (corroded) in all 3 pressure gauges I bought
customer_reviews.text: Pulled the battery tab and it didn't work. Removed the batteries and one of the batteries had corrosion on it. Put new batteries in it and it worked fine. I bought a total of three of these pressure gauges for my family. All three had corroded batteries. So you need to add $5.56 to the price of these pressure gauges because when they are shipped the batteries in them are bad. Would be nice if the seller sent me an Amazon GIFT CARD for $16.68 for the cost of the three sets of batteries I needed to replace in the pressure gauges.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Triangle NC

customer_reviews.title: Bullet proof!
customer_reviews.text: About 25 years ago I received one of exactly like this one for Christmas. It has worked flawlessly since the day I received it. The batteries didn’t even wear out. So when I lost it recently, (still working) I was delighted to find that it was still being made. The feature I like most about it is the “auto on”. Just put it on the valve stem and it displays the pressure. A few seconds later it turns off. My first one wasn’t back lit. The manufacturer added thi feature. Since it is an lcd display and not an led display, this feature makes it much easier to read pressures in the dark. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Krefeld70

customer_reviews.title: LR44 BATTERIES? NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Energizer LR44 batteries are too small. Cannot even contact this seller. Buy another brand! Mo beddah just buy any digital tire pressure reader and dispose of it rather than looking for new batteries. The readers are China-made cheap. I repeat. The LR44 batteries are NOT the correct replacements. I liked the old Amazon pressure gauge as they use the bigger CR2032 batteries and were easy to access by popping the bottom cover off manually and changing the batteries. Easy peasy. C'mon Amazon, make and sell those gauges again. They were the best and heavy and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: George Pill

customer_reviews.title: We have to trust the manufacturers for accuracy, but I had one like it & got another
customer_reviews.text: My first one of these (purchased at a local store that no longer exists) lasted many years. I read ALL the reviews of ALL the tire pressure gauges, & this one came out with the most consistent high rated reviews. Just be aware that there is a battery somewhere inside that canNOT be replaced, & when it dies you need a new gauge. But given the many years of service, who can complain about $10, still the same price as my first one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: 50s LabRat

customer_reviews.title: the only tire gauge you should use!
customer_reviews.text: I had received one of these tire gauges from my brother-in-law for christmas one year and really enjoyed it, but eventually it wore out. was happy to see them on the net, and bought 2, one for me and the other one for my borther-in-law for christmas. He didn't complain about it as he often does about gifts I had given him before, but maybe it might have been that I told him that he had bought this for me and I really enjoyed it, or he might have realized what a great product it is.
customer_reviews.author: hedge hog

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is questionable!
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is questionable! I received this gauge today and checked it for accuracy against three other gauges both stick type and dial gauge. I every case this Accutire gauge read about 3% lower than the other three tire pressure gauges from car tire pressure up to and including 120 lbs of my RV front tires. The gauges compared were a low pressure car tire stick, a high pressure truck tire stick and a high pressure dial gauge. I am going to assume from my tests that this Accutire gauge is off by about 3% on the low side since it was the only gauge that didn't match numbers.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBotts

customer_reviews.title: Power button and auto off is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: I had a different model Accutire pressure gauge that lasted over 10 years and was extremely accurate. I thought I would give this model a try. The screen is easy to read and the hand is very ergonomic. Seems to be really accurate. My only complaint is there is a power button and after around 10 seconds or so it cuts itself back off. This is annoying if checking multiple tires at a time. Multiple power button presses.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge, terrible handle
customer_reviews.text: Gauge itself works fine. I have one in each vehicle. Problem is that the rubberized handle gets sticky in heat then stays sticky. Most everyone's vehicles get hot in summer. Why would a manufacturer spend more to rubberize a handle when non rubberized and cheaper would be MUCH better. You can use lots of alcohol, goo be gone, etc and lots and lots of rubbing to eventually remove the rubberized coating. But why should anyone have to? Otherwise this gauge would be an easy 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: SCbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good, accurate tire pressure gauge with only one fault.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an accurate tire pressure gauge. After reading the review by a leading consumer testing organization I chose this one. Highly rated for its accuracy and repeatable results in varying temperatures. Very easy to read. Deducted a star because the gauge does not include the ability to lower air pressures. If a tire pressure tests too high, you have to find something to depress the tire valve stem. Many pressure gauges include this ability, but this one does not.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Roden

customer_reviews.title: Battery blew up when removed!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: When the batteries died on this unit I took them out to replace them and saw that they were (3) LR44 batteries stacked together. I noticed they were all bulging and leaking acid. I set them on my desk and two minutes later one POPPED, exploding battery acid and shrapnel throughout the room. I cautiously took the other two bulging batteries outside. Besides this, the unit has been fine and would've received 5 stars but I can't recommend it due to the incident we had.
customer_reviews.author: ArizonaSearingHeat

customer_reviews.title: Hmm, Maybe
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these. One works great and the second has display issue and is unusable. If they work they are easy to use and quite accurate. If they don't work and display strange characters then they are frustrating and of course not repairable. Also you better get a battery or two for it as they don't seem to last very long. This is why I rated this middle of the road yet all of the features very good - when/if it works.
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item several years ago on Amazon in part because of the reviews. In find that it gives a accurate reading WHEN it isn't giving an error code. I find that mine often needs to be applied over and over to get it to read. Sometimes its very frustrating when a 10 second read ends up taking five minutes because it does not read giving an LL flashing symbol over and over until you finally push it on exactly the way the device likes. Very finicky device (or at least the one I got is).
customer_reviews.author: TRM

customer_reviews.title: Battery Lasts 3 Yrs 8 Mo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2016. Battery died in 2020. I kept it in my truck, using intermittently. Always accurate (at least reads exactly what the tire monitoring on the truck says) and never failed. I like it a lot. It uses 3 LR44 button batteries and they lasted well over 3 years. Now, that’s not a battery I keep on hand, so when I needed it, and it stopped, I was sunk. But given the accuracy and longevity, it’s still 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JL Price in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last very long
customer_reviews.text: Inpurchases this three years ago and it’s now dead. As some folk here have complained it has an internal battery that can’t be replaced. Swapping out the three l44 coin battery was easy enough but when the main battery dies it’s end of life for this thing
customer_reviews.author: P. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: New models have a small power button!
customer_reviews.text: Almost threw this one away as would not work like the three others I have. Checked batteries, etc. THEN, while heading to the trash can, I noticed the little black button on the handle, pushed it, and unit came on! No instructions so luckily I noticed this. But all in all love these gauges. Might want to put a little arrow pointing to the button for repeat customers. Kind of like the tape you pull out to activate the older units batteries.
customer_reviews.author: sagetek

customer_reviews.title: Another Tire Pressure Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these since... forever! I ordered one for my fiancee and one for her son because I like a digital readout when checking tire pressure. We will see if these "new" ones will last as long as the one I own. Although, not made to fit into a wheel, for a recessed valve, nor will they work easily for some motorcycle tires, I like the way they fit into your hand and their ease of finding in a glove box or tool box.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The Best I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best, most accurate tire pressure monitor I have ever used. It is so much more convenient than an analogue gauge and very easy to use. I'm not a huge fan of the auto-off feature as you have to turn it back on between each tire, but the battery lasts a very long time. I keep one in my toolbox in the truck and the paint is just beginning to fade after about a year of regular use, but still works great! The perfect gift! Reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Corroded Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tire guage from TriStateValue and it arrived with corroded batteries. While I recommend the gauge itself, I do not recommend purchasing it from this particular vendor. The item was not eligible to be returned. However, Amazon did provide great customer service by giving me a refund for the batteries. After replacing the batteries, the gauge worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Compared this against two professional tire gauges used by two independent tire dealers. Their gauges were in the $150 to $225 range. The first place I checked read this at 25psi and their's read 23.7psi. The 2nd place I checked this read 66.7psi and their's read 66.1psi. They thought it was accurate enough. I decided to read my tire pressure 1psi below recommended using this gauge. Close enough to be satisfied. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MAJOR DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Dies before batteries do
customer_reviews.text: Purchased gauge for truck as needed higher pressure gauge. Liked results so purchased second one for car. Both worked fine for a year+ but then both died. In death each of them displayed 2.1 pounds pressure on a car tire that my old manual slide gauge displayed 31 pounds pressure. The ACCUTIRE gauges gave no problem indication that batteries were low or anything else. Replaced batteries even though old batteries worked well in flashlight. With new batteries both gauges still displayed only 2.1 pounds pressure on the tire with 31 pounds pressure. I suggest that you look elsewhere if you need a decent pressure gauge likely to last. My 5 year old manual slide gauge is still working well
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Twenty and out...
customer_reviews.text: I had this pressure gauge for approximately three years and likely used it twenty times. Then I got an “LL” message when I tried to use it. I bought and installed new batteries; still got same message. Two complaints: First it takes odd ball batteries; why not AAA... Second even though it cost only $11, I expect more than twenty uses. I likely will go back to an old style pressure gauge without batteries and electronics, as they last for decades. Update: Buy the Vondier heavy duty air pressure gauge for under $10. It has no batteries or electronics, is reliable and accurate and will last for many years. My recommendation is to keep walking past this thing...
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great gauge, but eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: I've got one of these for each of me three cars, purchased from 2011 through 2014. They've all worked flawlessly...except they eat batteries. While I use them infrequently (maybe once a month), the batteries need replacement almost every year. Yes, that's about a dozen uses. I suspect it's not the usage count but just the elapsed time - I suspect there's a design flaw that sucks the batteries dry over time. Three silver oxide 357 batteries a year adds up...for no reason/benefit. If I were starting over, I'd try a competitor.
customer_reviews.author: mkd

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I've used these Accutire gauges for years. I recently ordered two, one for the truck, one for the camper, and both arrived dead. I changed the batteries and both were still dead. I returned both for a refund. I am ordering another in hopes of getting a working gauge, but I am skeptical.
customer_reviews.author: David Eizinger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item. I love it! It is easy to use, gives an accurate reading, and is a nice quality item. As long as I keep misplacing my old ones, I'll keep buying new ones. Of course, after the new one arrives, the other one shows up. I think all my kids have one in their cars now. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Marks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is inexpensive and it works great. Recommended to me by a tire company engineer. This is my second one. Someone liked it so much they stole it. I liked it so much I purchased it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine was not as described, nor works...
customer_reviews.text: It takes me awhile to write reviews on some things. Especially when it's something that you've only picked up a couple of times, gotten frustrated with it, and it makes its way to the bottom of your tools. First of all, mine DID NOT come with any batteries. And certainly not rechargeable ones. I have actually been through 3 sets of batteries now (watch cell style, as it shows inside the battery compartment). The thing keeps draining them. I will use it once or twice, then a week later, use it again. And boom - dead. Maybe I just got a dud. Or a used one. I don't know. But mine was crap.
customer_reviews.author: SeanD

customer_reviews.title: One of the two was DOA
customer_reviews.text: I have used Accutire pressure gauges since 2014. The one I bought then finally stopped working, I had the batteries replaced but the contacts were corroded. The two I bought last week came. One was DOA, manufacture dates for both were 3/2018. These are cheap and I am not going to spend money to return it. The other one worked fine. 50/50 odds for getting a serviceable product is IMHO not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Ishan Bhattacharya

customer_reviews.title: An improvement over the classic, with a few pet peeves
customer_reviews.text: My old accutire gauge finally died after about 15 years LOL This one is an improvement in some areas over the old one that you couldn't change the battery in. You can change it out now, the display is easily readable in all conditions, the only sucky thing is that the gauge will turn itself off in a few seconds after using it, so you'll have to press the button to bring it back to life, a minor annoyance but they could have made it stay on a little longer as you are messing with the tire and caps. Seems pretty accurate
customer_reviews.author: radioboy

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool, faster and easier to use than analog!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool I keep in my door pocket. I used to always use analog gauges, but this one makes it so much easier and faster to check my tire pressures, I don't ever want to go back to analog. Pros: the display lights up, so you don't need a flashlight at night quick readout, much faster and more accurate than trying to read a dial cons: the batteries died after a few months. the shell is sensitive to drops p.s.: buy a pack of Energizer LR44 button cell batteries, they're only a couple of bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mojo

customer_reviews.title: Very slick! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've always had trouble getting tire pressure gauges to work. I would let tons of air out while trying to get a reading. This gauge works like a charm. There is no air leakage at all. I know it to be accurate because I have just returned from a local tire store where I had it checked. (This gauge was top rated by a popular product rating organization.) I will update my rating if there is any change over time.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Exremely User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This Accutire MS-4021B Digital Tire Pressure Gauge is extremely easy to use. Fits valve stems very snug, no leaking, and the readings are repeatable. Tried taking readings several times on the same tire and each time the result was the same. Will never go back to the old style gauges. This digital gauge is a sturdy, well made, tire gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Ponderer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic dissolves over time
customer_reviews.text: The black plastic that the handle is made out of has started to break down, turning gummy. It’s really gross. This happens with really cheap plastic. I’ve kept it in a glove box the whole time, so it’s not like this was exposed to ultraviolet light for years.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Jaquith

customer_reviews.title: Now the gauge constantly displays a beautifully illuminated bright red "000" over and over and over ...
customer_reviews.text: When I initially purchased this gauge it worked every other time. The first reading was always "000" and then the second time I pressed the gauge to the tire stem it registered an accurate pressure. After three months on the shelf I checked my tire pressure again with the gauge. Now the gauge constantly displays a beautifully illuminated bright red "000" over and over and over again. This gauge is crap. Save your $10 bucks and buy a mechanical gauge.
customer_reviews.author: TeeBall

customer_reviews.title: Can't replace batteries. Have to replace unit.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these in my first car for ten years or so. When the first one finally died, I got a new one thinking it would be of the same quality. The new one must have been lying around a warehouse with old batteries. Didn't last a year. Can't simply replace the battery and won't waste money on another one. Two stars for nostalgia only.
customer_reviews.author: JennA

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Don't rust any other kind of tire gauge. I have tried them all from the pencil types (notoriously inaccurate) to the round dial faced-gauges which are overrated. My on-board TPMS readings match this little unit spot on, while my expensive one was off as much as 10 pounds!! I am buying another for my other car.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Harrington, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Simple thievery.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work right out of the package. Red back light came on and stayed on. No numbers ever appeared. Removed and replaced batteries as the troubleshooting directions said to no effect. Went to Amazon to get return information and to my shock they simply said not returnable. They have functionally stolen $11+ from me. Shame on you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: lois

customer_reviews.title: PSSST...
customer_reviews.text: After having gone through a number of gauges that started giving erroneous readings, this one gives a reading out to a tenth of a pound. And in any lighting condition! Also has an easy to see display as opposed to the old fashion ones that you had to count the notches to verify the pressure reading. Haven't verified the accuracy or precision yet but I have to believe it's better than the last one I had that gave a different reading with multiple reads in less than a minute!
customer_reviews.author: Elwood T. Fudpucker

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later, still running strong and original battery
customer_reviews.text: 5 years later, still running strong and on original battery. One of the better purchases off amazon over the years. I used at least a dozen times a year, to check tires of my two cars and a trailer. It keeps the calibrated value pretty good, I would say, but I care most about balances amongst my tires so a little drift doesn't hurt anything (my educated guess is probably 1 psi judging from the pressure back from dealership). So far, so good. I am surprised how long the original battery has lasted thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate, checked it against two other pressure gauges and got the exact same reading.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Checked it against two other pressure gauges that I have and they all read exactly the same at 35psi. Much lighter than the heavy brass analog gauge (which is also very accurate) that i have in the other car. i got it because a major consumer testing service rated it the best of the low priced tire pressure gauges ... they were right.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Transplant

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge is so easy to use and gives confident measurements of tire pressure. The readout is easy to view and the reading holds long enough for you to note the reading. It is easy to handle and reads to one tenth pound. I recommend you carry one of these in each of your vehicles. A plus too for me was helping someone who needed their tire pressure measured at a gas station when the air hose had no built in gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hammersley

customer_reviews.title: Tire pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use pressure gauge. Gives me a very accurate pressure. Before I bought this I used a regular gauge that told me I had the correct pressure, turns out I was usually about 7 lbs over the correct pressure. I would constantly get the message on the dash about a tire pressure sensor fault. Since I stated using this gauge the problem has disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE FOLDI

customer_reviews.title: too hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these that was 20 years old. Thought this was a good spare. Hard to read in sunlight, display is red. Maybe good at night. It had a button on the front of it. after you push on valve stem of tire you had to push the button on it to get the tire pressure. called Amazon to get return shipping label, Amazon was very nice. Told me to throw it away, the refund was on the card. too hard to use
customer_reviews.author: james woods

customer_reviews.title: Low battery/ Dead after 60 days, Lo won’t take a reading
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 7...and today is Jun 1....BATTERY LOW/DEAD. doesn’t take a reading. Light out and I used it maybe 12x. Batteries are LR44 Tiny batteries I guess? I mean it’s only $10.50 so what did I expect? Plus I always had to turn it in the right direction to see the reading. POOR Display.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaDream

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, robust, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool, accurate to 0.5 PSI. The batteries last a long time. The manual does not state the following: if you install replacement batteries and one of them is a tad low, the screen will read "ER" for "Error". Button cell batteries don't register properly on common household "clamp style" battery testers: you need to use a true Volt meter. Because the manual omitted this information, I only rated 4 stars. Nevertheless, I would buy this unit again!
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Good shape for pressing onto the valve without ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good shape for pressing onto the valve without leaking. You can put your thumb right in line with the valve. and the extended tip is enough for most applications. Usually I over-inflate a little and bleed down to what I want. Measures in 1/2# increments, so it can be touchy if you are close to the # you want to get it just right. I had one of these for some time, and it stopped working. I think the permanent battery inside died. It was faster and probably just as cheap to buy a new one as to send the old one back for (free) repair. Bought 2 more for my sons.
customer_reviews.author: Rick the Ace

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and provides and accurate reading. What else do you want?
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, and provides an accurate reading. The Accutire pressure gauge is made of a fairly cheap plastic- but it's not really meant to be beaten up anyways. Still, it is small, lightweight, and fits into the tires of all my vehicles easily. In a couple of seconds, it provides and accurate reading that I have compared to numerous air pumps and gauges that I have at home. The digital screen is easy to read and I have have no problems using it in harsh sunlight yet. Most definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge is an improvement on the previous version, which I had for over eight years. On this one you have to remember to push a little button to turn it on before taking your tire's pressure. I recommend this one as it is easier to get a reading because it fits over the tire valve better than the previous version. Also it is easy to read in direct sunlight and has a decent display.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to operate tire guage. More accurate and provides a much better seal than model MS-4350B. The contact point on this model is a brass screw, but on the Accutire set point model there is a plastic nipple which does not make a good seal. Also, the seating of the tire valve is much, much deeper on this model than the 4350B. Less movement and better seal. One note: The display on my guage is gold over black not red over black.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D. Hendon

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a similar old Accutire gauge? read the directions!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace identical Accutire gauge that died after many years. Pulled battery tab and checked pressure -but nothing displayed. THEN reviewed directions: There's a tiny black unlabeled "ON" button under the nozzle -not easily noticed. This button wasn't on my old gauge! Pressed the "ON" button, then the display activated and gauge works fine. If it lasts as long as the previous one I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: so easy! i love checking tires for friends now when they come over, with my nifty tool- no, seriously, im obsessed with tire pressure now. so easy to use, battery still never went dead, can't believe it took me 15 yrs to get a digital rather than the old school 'read between the lines" kind. game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Xenia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: display is operated by a single button. Each reading lingers for quite a while, so it takes longer than necessary to check 4 tires. Shutting it down and restarting is a bit faster, but a huge hassle. Angle of view for the display is also extremely narrow and inconvenient
customer_reviews.author: bonobo

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself seems larger than necessary, but that maybe due to ergonomic reasons. I can only compare the reading to an analog gauge I got from a tire shop, and it reads about the same (I'm thinking it's probably more accurate than the analog gauge). Push the wake up button, push down on the valve, wait at least half a second, and read the results. What more can you ask for in a tire pressure gauge? It'll be seeing weekly use when I do my weekly tire pressure checks.
customer_reviews.author: Lazandro S. Sapinoso

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I am confused I saw bad reviews which I mostly ignore. This tire pressure gauge is wonderful. It is a perfect angle design for getting in to the valve and getting a good grip on it. The read out is wonderful and it is so easy to use, changing the readout is easy
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: My go-to choice of tire gauges
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these several years ago for myself because of its accuracy and design. When I realized that my son needed a good tire gauge, I bought this one as a stocking-stuffer Christmas gift for him. I have yet to have any problems with mine, and have never even had to replace the batteries. I expect the same quality will apply to this one.
customer_reviews.author: DRath

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work/no refunds!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work and even though it hasn’t been thirty days, it won’t let me return it for a refund. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kelleyanne

customer_reviews.title: Right On Accu-rate
customer_reviews.text: Finally I have an accurate gauge. It is right on. I have had gauges vary up to 8 lbs from gauge to gauge. How do you set your tire pressures with a gauge like that. When I started using this one, it was a happy day since then. No more worry. It even matched the TPMS readout in the dash! Totally recommend this one. I would be even happier if it made an audible sound when it gets a reading. I love it the way it is though. It is easy to line up before pressing onto the valve stem so I just hold it for a second or so and the reading is there. Without leakage! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rita’s cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Withstands the HEAT in your car, BUY this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several electronic tire gauges and this one is the best in usability, accuracy and durability. All of my other gauges have died from the Atlanta Heat. This one holds up. It's always in my car and is there when I need it. It's important to me that you spend your money on devices that work and are ultimately cheaper and keep good manufacturers in business. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the 7th one of these I have purchased. I liked it so well I have purchased for my wife, my two children and their spouses. My grandson just turned 16 and he got the last one I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: logger

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good choice. I compared it to four gauges and it grouped with the others for readings. Still, I could not check 5-stars because I don't love it due to it not having a bleeder button. I would buy it again though as a gauge to keep in the car. For my garage, I would want to own one large dial gauge with a hose and bleeder valve.
customer_reviews.author: Phönix

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As with any tire pressure gauge it's straightforward and easy to ready but I like that it's digital so makes it more accurate. I had tires on an old car that loose pressure so need to make sure it's accurate for which these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Umar

customer_reviews.title: Used this only 3 times
customer_reviews.text: Only used for about 3 times and hasn't worked. I initially thought it was the batteries so I got a new set and still didn't work. I have a similar one I got about 10 years ago on the original batteries and it still works what gives?!?! Quality has gone down unfortunately. Did I get a lemon?????
customer_reviews.author: Giants WSC

customer_reviews.title: Great, accurate product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this product has worked great. I have used it on a number of bike tires ranging from 35 psi to 90 psi and it has given accurate, easy readings every time. I've also used it on automobile tires with the same success. Just make sure you get a tight seal when you push this onto the valve stem or you get inaccurate readings. This gauge is small and lightweight and fits easily in my travel pack. I haven't had any battery issues in the year since I've purchased it. I'm assuming it won't last forever but since it wasn't that expensive to begin with it's easily replaceable and I would buy another in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Pk

customer_reviews.title: When driving to and from places you need to check your tires.
customer_reviews.text: I do drive a lot like seven days a week I need to check my tires always, now I'm going to purchase new tires. I can't believe how many times I go to full of tires with air and a lot of the gas stations don't have this type of device to check on how air is in the tire. I leave it in the glove compartment. I know it's always there when I need it. ffsalsa/ff
customer_reviews.author: ffsalsa/ff

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. Very accurate. I have calibrated it against the car dealership equipment and it is right on. Never had a digital before, but this works great. Minimal pressure loss when disconn3cting from valve stem.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz_Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 3 years, just died.
customer_reviews.text: Had the older LCD version of this for 3 years, got it for travel trailer, been tracking a slow leak this week and it just went dead, no display, no light. Replaced the 3 button batteries with new that I tested first, still dead. Not used that much, say once a month. Guess 3 years is the lifespan of this one. Will see what else is available.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tire Pressure Guage
customer_reviews.text: I received the older model witch I like better then the new model with the button. Much easier to use. I have a 8 year old model that still works but wanted a new one. Never a problem when I go to use it. Battery last years. Works in cold or hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Silecchio

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: This little tire gauge is much easier and more accurate than the old type with the slide stick. An added benefit is that you could use it in the dark. Arrived early, in perfect condition with easy to follow instructions. With 2 vehicles to check, if this gauge lasts a year or so, it's money well spent. If you are a professional, or own a tire shop, you'd probably want to upscale, but this one will do fine for weekly checks, and now I'll be certain to check more often, cause I like to use it. I'll even volunteer to check my neighbor's cars.
customer_reviews.author: Layton P.Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Good product, flaw in design makes it prone to breaking
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and they worked well for a while but there is a design flaw, the nozzle is connected to the body of the gauge by a thin ring of plastic (the black part connecting to the gold body) and it was just a matter of time before it snapped at that location. If you are extremely careful, it will probably be OK, but if you just put it in your console or glove box with the rest of your stuff, it is at serious risk of breaking.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Check your tires before you leave on your trip
customer_reviews.text: This tire gage is easy to use and is accurate. I bought this gage so that I could check my rv trailer tires before I take off on my trips. This way I have avoided tire failure.
customer_reviews.author: Paul McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple of years, replaced batteries, but still doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It seemed very accurate, but it stopped working one day after a couple of years. Tried and tried to find the replacement LR44 batteries and couldn't, so I had to buy a 20 pack of LR44 batteries from Amazon. However, when I put the new batteries in, it still didn't work. Very frustrated. Now, in addition to the 20 LR44 batteries, I have to buy a new gauge.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG K SPAWN

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my step son a few months ago. His was great. I re-ordered one for myself, but the model I got was slightly different (didn't make as smooth a contact with the tire valve as the older one I bought). If I needed one again I'd look for a better model.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Quality apparently no longer what it used to be. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: After being a very satisfied user of Accutire MS-4021 for years, I decided to buy another one for my son. When we used it for the first time it had only had a dim, erratic display of digits. We assumed this to mean that we had bad batteries (even though we had just pulled the battery tape). But even new batteries didn't improve things. Another big disappointment came when Amazon's customer service informed us that the item is not eligible for return. So my recommendation: Don't buy this brand!
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I had a recent issue with my tire pressure light going on when it got cold, so I was guessing on which tire to add air to. Turns out I was wrong when I went to a tire shop to have them checked. While I didn't do any damage to my tires, I did decide to look for a pressure gauge in case it happened again so I would know exactly which tire needs air should it happen again and found this one. The day I got the gauge in the mail, I actually had the light go on so I was able to figure out which tire needed air. This is a handy little gadget to have!
customer_reviews.author: A reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Don't let your GF borrow your tools....
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an older one that I had for better than 5 years. It is the same model as my old one that got run over when my significant other borrowed it and didn't realize she left it on the tire. This is also why you don't let your significant other borrow your tools. She got her very own for X-mas so if she breaks it this time, it's on her.... Good gauge. Does what it is supposed to do and the batteries on the old one where original. Surprising considering it gets used weekly. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tim the Destroyer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate & Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an identical unit that failed after many, many years of dependable service when it suffered a hard drop onto concrete. The readings correspond very closely to those from the tire pressure readings from the tire pressure measurement devices inside the tires on my two vehicles. I check my tires at least monthly and credit the accurate readings in helping me to get well beyond the tire manufacturer's claimed mileage for my tires. Another reason that I like this particular unit is that it can read the higher pressure (60 PSI) required for the compact spare tires for my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: Get this.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and Very easy to use. Highly rated by Consumer Reports and used by the pros at Car and Driver Magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Richeson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the glove box!
customer_reviews.text: I worked in a tire shop for years, and have owned lots of heavy equipment, a few race bikes, etc. This gauge is great. Pros: Cheap, very very accurate, easy to use, and seals as good as any gauge without a lock, small, quick. Cons: It is made from cheap plastic, so you have to take care of it, it does not store the reading(s). does not seal perfectly every time, but that is rare anyways and depends on your valve stem too. This is perfect for the glove box! I would not buy it for a shop, unless you can take care of it. Note: I have only used it for couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fowler

customer_reviews.title: stable sensor
customer_reviews.text: this is the third one of these ive bought. first one went through the washing machine and died. the one i got recently vs the vs the 2nd one i got a few years ago read identically after zeroing out both. now i have no idea how accurate that is vs a reference but it does tell me that the sensor remains stable despite aging. so at the worst you could find the offset vs a reference meter and know that the offset will remain stable over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Maki Michii

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to read the display
customer_reviews.text: Both pictures show a 0.0 on the display. The one on the white background is in the sun and the other is in the shade. The one in the sun is impossible to read and the shady one is only marginal. This thing uses an LCD display with a red LED for illumination. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: wanna love it but I cant
customer_reviews.text: At the beinnig I was really excited because of the lcd tire pressure gauge, and it works! but unfortunately, these are not built to last. In a couple of months, the cap start to feel loose, and the pressure measurement were erratic, I cant trush the readings anymore, better go with and analogic version tool
customer_reviews.author: Osiricat

customer_reviews.title: Excels at a menial task
customer_reviews.text: Only reason it doesn’t get five stars is that the unit of measure selection is a bit clunky, other than that it’s easy to use and easy to read. Does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Baker

customer_reviews.title: NOT  "Accurate to within 0.05 PSI"
customer_reviews.text: I just received this device at it appears to work. The print showing the units is vanishing small, and should be made larger. I was mislead when I purchased it be seeing "Accurate to within 0.05 PSI" while I ignored the rest: it reads air pressure "in 0.5 pound increments". This specification is misleading at best. If you attached it to a source with 5.2PSI it would read 5PSI, clearly not accurate to within 0.05PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gauge 5 months ago and have used it a number of times since then to measure tire pressure in all our cars. This is a quality tire gauge that I find easy to use. The digital readout is vastly superior to that on cheap analog tire pressure gauges that I've had. Much easier to read and much more accurate too. I don't use those old gauges anymore. This Accutire gauge is now the only one that I use. I haven't had to replace the battery yet, but I don't expect it to be an issue when the time comes. Definitely money well spent! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wanderfeet

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth one I have purchased (left the prior one in the car I sold). They seem sufficiently accurate, and the measurement is repeatable, so have confidence that tires are at similar pressures. Convenient as there is no on/off switch, and display lights, and locks on the final pressure, for long enough to see the pressure. Easy to read in all light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: WhtShadow

customer_reviews.title: The gauge works as describe.
customer_reviews.text: I have no major complaints. Time will tell how it performs in the future but I would recommend this product to my friends. Sorry, but no one gets 5 stars unless the item is somehow extraordinary.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Wish the display stayed on when pulled away from the valve.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to read when the tire pressure is displayed. We use on the outer beaches of Long Island, when we have to air the Jeep down, and again when we leave, putting air back in. Once you pull it away form the tire to actually read, the screen shuts off. You have to read it while it is on the tire valve. This is indeed tough if the sun is bright- shining down on the screen and tough if you need reading glasses to see . The gauge is indeed accurate and dependable otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: VWCamper

customer_reviews.title: Handy Gadget
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to get use to the tire pressure instrument, but it works fine. The reading did not come up immediately like another one I have. There was a short delay.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reints

customer_reviews.title: Fits well inside alloy wheels !
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement of an older model ! This newer one has an off and on switch ! Saves battery ! Newer battery ! Not the old sealed quarter sized one ! just a better air gage all around !
customer_reviews.author: borgy

customer_reviews.title: This is easy to use and is pretty much exactly what I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and is pretty much exactly what I was looking for. I have compared it to the expensive tire pressure gauges we use here at work and it is just as accurate as they are. The digital readout is easy to read in the day time and the night time. I have no idea how long the battery will last on this thing, but since I am only using it a few minutes at a time I can’t imagine it will drain it too quickly. The digital readout is very handy for getting the tires exactly where I need them on all four corners. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: consistent!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know for a fact that these are accurate but they sure are consistent in their measurements (unless you let air out of your tire in between measurements). Non-digital gauges have always varied a lot each time I took a measurement, and I think that was due to the inherent unreliability of mechanical gauges. Be sure to hold it straight and this will give you a very fast, easy to read readout and it will be the same each time. Add a little air, and the readout increases a little. Let a little out and the numbers go down. Now that's reassuring. It will replace all of my inconsistent fickle-minded hard-to-read gauges.
customer_reviews.author: Figmaglee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Accurate !!!
customer_reviews.text: Best tire gauge available. I have one that's 18yrs old and finally failed. I engrave my tools with my initials and purchase date. I have several of these and found that they far outlast most other brands that I had to dispose of. Good for cars, trucks and SUV's. My RV-MH tires require inflation of 110psi and these work great on them. Highly recommend these gauges !!
customer_reviews.author: gptexas

product_meta.title: Accutire MS-4021B Digital Tire Pressure Gauge
product_meta.description: Color:Silver/BlackThe Accutire MS-4021B digital tire pressure gauge features a large, easy to read LCD display that provides pressure readings from 5-150 PSI in 0.5-pound increments. It is ergonomically designed with an angled head and a rubber coated easy-grip handle. The heavy-duty construction will easily withstand shifting around in your glove compartment or toolbox. If you forget to turn the gauge off, don't worry, it is equipped with an automatic shut off system.
feature_bullets: Heavy duty construction and rugged design for long lasting use
Angled head and rubber coated handle for easy gripping
Equipped with an automatic shut off to prevent deflation
Accurate to within 0.5 PSI, reading air pressure from 5-150 PSI in 0.5 pound increments

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,175 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
